scenario.field: The wilds call out to the wild. Hard working and adventurous, the proud ants never let anything get in the way of progress. Their noble spirit is what drove them to adapt to the land and learn its ways. Now, generations after the first ants stepped off their arks, the ants have triumphed in taming the wilderness. In the battle that is to come, the land itself is their ally.

"You should never play with fire unless you make others get burned." That lesson has been passed down amongst fire ants for ages. Stubborn, hot headed and fiery of temper, the only thing that cools their energetic spirits is adventure and plenty of it. That's what makes them the best fighters the Anterium has ever had. How about it? Think you have what it takes to play with fire?

Long ago, the butterflies looked down upon the arks that made it across the sea. Always in pursuit of knowledge, the delicate looking natives earned the respect and trust of the newcomers to the extent that their wisdom is now part of the driving force behind the Anterium. Wise and crafty, their minds are dangerous playgrounds for powers that demand respect for these noble citizens.

Noble and majestic, the bees are the rulling class behind the hegemony. In the early days of colonisation, their shrewed cunning enabled them to take charge of what was to become one of the greatest nations in history. Keepers of powerful magic and lore, the bees jealously guard their place as the Hegemony's elite.

Skilled scouts and marksmen, the ladybugs have proven their value again and again in the years leading up to the current troubled peace with the Anterium. Despite the lack of conflict, these valiant adventurers have not allowed their skills to dull. When a mission requires finess, then the Hegemony leadership knows exactly where to find its volunteers.

Strong in will and body, the mantis is a skilled warrior and one of the few whose strength can truly match the resilience of a Fire Ant. Believing in balance above all else, the mantises dedicate years of their lives to the study of the Natural Equilibrium. Their understanding and discipline makes them into the fierce warriors that welcomed and impressed their allies during the early days of colonisation.
